author: BS Reporter
title: Madhu Kapur can ask RBI to clarify on two YES Bank board appointments: HC News
text:
The Bombay High Court on Monday said that Madhu Kapur & family can obtain clarification from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on its approval related to appointment of M R Srinivasan and Diwan Arun Nanda on the board of YES Bank.

Madhu Kapur had filed a petition in the Bombay High Court in June and had sought a stay on two directors Diwan Arun Nanda and M R Srinivasan assuming office. The next hearing is on July 27.

The YES Bank spokesperson said: "In the hearing today, the Honourable Bombay High Court, upon the insistence of the Plaintiffs (Madhu Kapur & family) counsel, consented for the Plaintiffs to obtain clarification from RBI on its existing approval related to 2 Directors, viz., M R Srinivasan and Diwan Arun Nanda until October 2016. Both these directors were duly elected by the shareholdersâ€™ at the last Annual General Meeting and RBI has categorically approved their continuance, after noting that they have crossed 70 years."

The spokesperson added that therefore, this is a mere clarificatory enquiry.

ALSO READ:  YES Bank sees Macquarie, BofA-ML, Edelweiss reassurance after UBS downgrade 
Earlier, in 2013, Madhu Kapur & her family had moved Bombay High Court, claiming her right as the bank's co-promoter was violated and she wasn't consulted before the bank had appointed a few directors on its board. In June 2015, the court said that the appointment of board members be exercised jointly by the promoters, not individually.
